net.objectzoo.delegates

Interface Action<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the Action's parameter
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Consumer<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventAsyncDelegate<T>, EventDelegate<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActionAsyncSupport, ActionToAsyncAction, EventAsyncAdapter, EventCaller, EventDistributor
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Action<T>
extends java.util.function.Consumer<T>
    An Action is a reference to a procedure without return value that can be invoked synchronously similar to a regular Java method call. To enable interoperability with Java 8 libraries Action is replaceable with its super interface Consumer in many situations.
    Author:
    tilmann

      static <T> Action0 bindParameter(java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> consumer, T parameter)
      Binds the given parameter to the given Consumer returning a new Action0 that acts as an invocation of the Consumer with the given parameter.
      default Action0 bindParameter(T parameter)
      Binds the given parameter to this Action returning a new Action0 that acts as an invocation of this Action with the given parameter.
      static <T> java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.function.Consumer<? super T>> boundAcceptingConsumer(T parameter)
      Creates a Consumer that calls accept(Object) with the given parameter on the consumed Consumers.
      static <T> Action<T> from(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
      Converts the given Consumer into an Action that invokes the consumer.
      static <T> Action<T> from(java.util.function.Function<T,?> function)
      Converts the given Function into an Action that invokes the function and then ignores its return value.
